description.narrative: Output 1.5: By 2018, health facilities and community structures have strengthened capacities to prepare for and respond to epidemics, natural disasters and population displacement, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Children under 5 years of age and pregnant women, particularly the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality high-impact interventions for the prevention and management of maternal and childhood illnesses, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5: By 2018, health facilities and community structures have strengthened capacities to prepare for and respond to epidemics, natural disasters and population displacement

description.narrative: In 2018, Unicef strongly support on emergency preparedness and response leading to the vaccination of 158,285 children aged 9 months to 14 years in measles vaccination response. An evaluation of mobile clinics has also been made in Diffa Region and the implementation of recommendations is underway. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019
